item.title: Traffic lights changing too quickly creating congestion, 21st March
item.description:
The traffic lights at this location on the Hucclecote Road near the Hucclecote Methodist Church are changing too quickly. This is creating significant congestion on the Hucclecote Road, of 20 plus cars. The sequencing of the lights needs to be changed back to what it was before the road works so more cars can flow. I now have cars, double decker buses etc stationary outside my house regularly during the day, which hasn't happened before. This has created access issues to the house, noise, reduced privacy and additional pollution.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hucclecote Road, Hucclecote, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lack of concrete curb stones on Battledown Approach between Battledown Drive and Haywards Lane, 21st March
item.description:
There is a lack of concrete curb stones on Battledown Approach between Battledown Drive and Haywards Lane. There is a school on Battledown Approach which means that twice a day parents are parking vehicles on what were once grass verges but now are muddy swamps (see attached photo of just one of several affected sections). This mud mixes with the leaves and twigs from the trees and is washed into the drains, causing blockages and covering the gulleys. There is a risk that it will block the combined sewer which would result in residents experiencing raw sewerage in their homes. In addition the edge of the road is being gradually broken up due to the lack of curbing. There is also an impact on the pavement which is becoming increasingly difficult for people with mobility issues to navigate.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Battledown Approach, Ewens Farm, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Disgusting that you are reporting it is repaired, 21st March
item.description:
Think it is disgusting you are reporting that priors rd has now been repaired. It has not and is getting worse by the day. Are you waiting for someone to be killed. Car drivers are having to swerve to avoid the holes. Itâ€™s only a matter of time before there are fatalities

item.title: New fence has obstructed the bridleway, 21st March
item.description:
We walk this way on a regular basis and can see that this bridalway has been reduced by the fence errected by the homeowner on the left if you enter from old gloucester road. I have checked the boundary and can see that the bridalway has been reduced from about 9 and a half feet to about 5 feet.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Old Gloucester Road, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
